text: Jamesoniella undulifolia, the marsh flapwort, or marsh earwort, is a species of liverwort in the Jungermanniaceae family. It is found in Austria, China, the Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greenland, North Korea, Norway, Poland, Russia, Sweden, Switzerland, and the United Kingdom. Its natural habitat is swamps. It is threatened by habitat loss. == Sources == * Bryophyte Specialist Group 2000. Jamesoniella undulifolia. 2006 IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Downloaded on 22 August 2007.
